definitions.meaning: 为工作、服务或损失提供的金钱或物质回报
definitions.usage: 通常指雇主支付给员工的薪资、奖金、福利等，或者为损失、伤害等提供的赔偿金。

examples.scene: 一位员工在公司年会上与HR讨论今年的薪资调整情况。
examples.chineseIdea: 员工想知道公司是否会根据他们的工作表现提供额外的薪资或奖金。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: Employees who worked overtime this year will @ @ for their efforts.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: Employees who worked overtime this year will 「receive compensation」 for their efforts.
examples.chineseTranslation: 今年加班的员工将「获得报酬」以表彰他们的努力。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：'Get money for work.' 纠正：'Receive compensation for their efforts.'

examples.scene: 一位顾客在餐厅因为服务不佳而投诉，经理希望平息顾客的不满。
examples.chineseIdea: 经理想通过提供一些回报来安抚顾客，比如免费餐点或折扣。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: To resolve the complaint, the manager decided to @ @ to the customer.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: To resolve the complaint, the manager decided to 「offer compensation」 to the customer.
examples.chineseTranslation: 为了解决投诉，经理决定「提供赔偿」给顾客。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：'Give customer free things.' 纠正：'Offer compensation to the customer.'

definitions.meaning: 弥补或平衡某事物不足的行为或措施
definitions.usage: 指通过某些行动或机制来抵消或平衡负面影响、不足或缺陷，常用于抽象或技术性语境。

examples.scene: 一位工程师在设计新能源车时讨论如何提高电池效率。
examples.chineseIdea: 工程师想通过调整系统来抵消电池在低温下的性能下降。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: The new system will @ @ for the battery’s reduced efficiency in cold weather.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: The new system will 「make compensation」 for the battery’s reduced efficiency in cold weather.
examples.chineseTranslation: 新系统将「进行补偿」以应对电池在寒冷天气下效率降低的问题。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：'Fix battery problem.' 纠正：'Make compensation for the battery’s reduced efficiency.'

examples.scene: 一位老师在课堂上调整教学方式以照顾不同学习能力的学生。
examples.chineseIdea: 老师希望通过额外资源或活动来平衡学生之间的学习差距。
examples.sentenceWithBlank: The teacher used group activities to @ @ for students’ varying skill levels.
examples.fullEnglishSentence: The teacher used group activities to 「provide compensation」 for students’ varying skill levels.
examples.chineseTranslation: 老师通过小组活动「提供补偿」以平衡学生不同的技能水平。
examples.chinglishFix: 典型中式英语：'Help students learn same.' 纠正：'Provide compensation for students’ varying skill levels.'
